  16. (** This module provides common implementations for internals of [Toploop], for
  17.     bytecode and native code (see [Topeval] for the diverging parts of the
  18.     implementation).

  20.     You should not use it directly, refer to the functions in [Toploop] instead.
  21. *)

  23. (**/**)

  26.    bytecode and native *)

  131. (* Interface with toplevel directives *)

  133. ‌type directive_fun =
  134.   | Directive_none of (unit -> unit)
  135.   | Directive_string of (string -> unit)
  136.   | Directive_int of (int -> unit)
  137.   | Directive_ident of (Longident.t -> unit)
  138.   | Directive_bool of (bool -> unit)

  140. ‌type directive_info = {
  141.   section: string;
  142.   doc: string;
  143. }

  146.    @since 4.03 *)

  187. (* Hooks *)

  189. ‌val toplevel_startup_hook : (unit -> unit) ref

  191. ‌type event = ..
  192. type event +=
  193.   | Startup
  194.   | After_setup
  195.   (* Just after the setup, when the toplevel is ready to evaluate user
  196.      input. This happens before the toplevel has evaluated any kind of
  197.      user input, in particular this happens before loading the
  198.      [.ocamlinit] file. *)

  200. ‌val add_hook : (event -> unit) -> unit
  201. (* Add a function that will be called at key points of the toplevel
  202.    initialization process. *)

  204. ‌val run_hooks : event -> unit
  205. (* Run all the registered hooks. *)

  207. (* Misc *)

  209. ‌val override_sys_argv : string array -> unit
  210. (* [override_sys_argv args] replaces the contents of [Sys.argv] by [args]
  211.    and reset [Arg.current] to [0].

  213.    This is called by [run_script] so that [Sys.argv] represents
  214.    "script.ml args..." instead of the full command line:
  215.    "ocamlrun unix.cma ... script.ml args...". *)

  217. (** [is_command_like_name s] is [true] if [s] is an implicit basename with no
  218.     file extension and which doesn't begin with a hyphen. Basically, if it looks
  219.     like a sub-command name (e.g. ocaml help). *)
  220. ‌val is_command_like_name : string -> bool

  222. (**/**)

  224. (* internal functions used by [Topeval] *)

  226. ‌type evaluation_outcome = Result of Obj.t | Exception of exn

  228. ‌val backtrace: string option ref

  230. ‌val parse_mod_use_file:
  231.   string -> Lexing.lexbuf -> Parsetree.toplevel_phrase list

  233. ‌val refill_lexbuf: bytes -> int -> int
